sn22.110:1.5: The stream-enterer (as in the previous discourse) and the perfected one (arahant) share the same understanding of the aggregates as they truly are, but the arahant has fully let go of all grasping. Note too that the stream-enterer is said to be a “noble disciple”, which includes lay people, but the arahant is a “mendicant”. The discourses do not say that formal ordination is a requirement for arahantship, but they consistently treat the arahant as one who lives the renunciate life of a mendicant.
